newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Dec 31.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - Dec 31.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on December 31. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Tariffs for local telephone calls will rise by 4.56 percent on New Year's Day.

A provincial military leader has said in the riot torn West Java town of Tasikmalaya that last week's disturbance, which government officials estimated caused 85 billion rupiah ($36 million) in damage, was an opportunity for authorities to be introsepctive.
The government says more than five million foreign tourists are expected to visit Indonesia this year and spend about $6.18 billion.

The subversion trials of independent labour leader Mucthar Pakpahan and nine activists of the small left-wing People's Democratic Party (PRD) will proceed with evidence taking next week after judges ruled all the accused had a case to answer.
Minister for Tourism, Post and Telecommunications Joop Ave said telephone tariffs would be reviewed every year by the government.
The ruling Golkar party has said in an end of year statement that the gap between rich and poor could have a negative effective on the community's life as well as national unity.
